abstract: Performs the service when no custom view controller is provided.
overview:
## Discussion

The default implementation of this method does nothing. If your service doesn’t provide any custom UI using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityViewController] method, override this method and use it to perform the activity. Your activity must operate on the data items received in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/prepare(withActivityItems:)] method.

This method is called on your app’s main thread. If your app can complete the activity quickly on the main thread, do so and call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] method when it’s done. If performing the activity might take some time, use this method to start the work in the background and then exit without calling [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] from this method. When your background work has completed, call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)]. You must call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] on the main thread.

# perform()

**Instance Method**

Performs the service when no custom view controller is provided.

## Declaration

```swift
func perform()
```

## Discussion

The default implementation of this method does nothing. If your service doesn’t provide any custom UI using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityViewController] method, override this method and use it to perform the activity. Your activity must operate on the data items received in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/prepare(withActivityItems:)] method.

This method is called on your app’s main thread. If your app can complete the activity quickly on the main thread, do so and call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] method when it’s done. If performing the activity might take some time, use this method to start the work in the background and then exit without calling [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] from this method. When your background work has completed, call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)]. You must call [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIActivity/activityDidFinish(_:)] on the main thread.

## Performing the activity

- **canPerform(withActivityItems:)**: Queries whether the service can act on the specified data items.
- **prepare(withActivityItems:)**: Prepares your service to act on the specified data.
- **activityViewController**: The view controller to present to the user.
- **activityDidFinish(_:)**: Notifies the system that your activity object has completed its work.
